user.description: Half machine,  half ninja, and two-thirds awesome. I specialise in Ruby/Rails and own in BC2. I also made @myTransit
user.name: chendo

retweeted_status.text: Man from Old Spice responds to the internet: http://bit.ly/alG3hz

text: RT @chendo: Man from Old Spice responds to the internet: http://bit.ly/alG3hz
Still want to grow up to be Frank Black
@whalec hell to the yeah.
@whalec still writing kids' apps, then?
@GarryDanger still the maybe monad, you just interpret True as Nothing instead. (Almost - Either, really)
@toolmantim heh, just on the edge. my bike's almost in storage, though :/
&& is the Maybe monad. How did I not realise that before?
@snapperwolf can I get a minute or two of rant time? just an announcement, not a talk (more haskell advocacy, natch)
@johtib hell, that's very tempting. Why must Australia be so far away from so much cool stuff?
@rufuspost @garrydanger actually, that _was_ a reply from my bot. He's getting good, isn't he? I'm so proud.
@gabehollombe it's the next step. I think we'd have to run vms, though - everyone develops locally, and clashing would be painful.
@mwotton ah. Of course the database ID needs to be 2, 3, 7 or 8. Duh.
oh joy, the test passes in isolation but fails in my 15 minute cucumber run.
Of course, @atnan was exploring the marianas trench on a two- wheeler of his own design. /cc @rufuspost @garrydanger
@GarryDanger so you could wheel it to the cafe and discuss Belle and Sebastian?
@rufuspost 10 more than you.
@bacek haven't had a Linux laptop for a while. My emacs setup's in git, of course, but the other stuff is a bit idiosyncratic.
I always forget how much is involved in setting up a new laptop. git keys, rvm, ghc, chrome, emacs, ghc-mod....

aw, cute, hubris is lonely:

* Missing C libraries: ruby, ruby, ruby
@eraserhd I think it helps a lot to try the features out in a real compiler first.
@eraserhd
@GarryDanger drink deep from the source, young padawan: http://funroll-loops.info/
@zedshaw it's a bit backwards. ideally you want a lazy system, I guess - if you ask about something, check it, otherwise don't bother.
@rufuspost funroll your own loops, I have Haskell to write. I'm going back to Ubuntu.
So far, getting a real debian-ten-years-ago feel off Arch Linux. No, please, let me modprobe my own Ethernet modules. (I feel so manly)
@glenmaddern suffer the bloodnuts to come to me #gingerjesus
@whalec @filterfish when was the last time you decided beer o clock was inadvisable?
@conal eliezer wrote about the difficulty of changing your mind:  http://lesswrong.com/lw/jx/we_change_our_minds_less_often_than_we_think/
@AndrePang the amazing thing is that the dog plays the harmonica at all... @bacek was trying to convince me to port ghz to parrot, actually
@AndrePang ah, that's cute. looking forward to the LLVM GHC backend being standard, it wouldn't be too hard to pull the same trick in Hubris
@bacek I hate you and everything you stand for.
@lightningdb @sutto it does have a good rep in the haskell community. am leaning toward ubuntu, though, for sheer laziness.
so, before I remove the stain of Windows XP from this shiny new netbook, any Linux distro recommendations? I usually run Ubuntu.
@robertpostill A good type system is golden. Don't judge Hindley-Milner systems on Java, C++, and their officious kindred.
@robertpostill Haskell is lisp with lasers and robots and bad-ass unicorns.
@robertpostill ha, i thought it might be http://www.realworldhaskell.org/
@robertpostill and http://java.sun.com/docs/books/jls/ to give her nightmares?
@DmitryBaranovsk @chrislloyd that lambda behaviour is fixed in ruby 1.9 anyway - not shadowing is just plain broken.
@MDTom tabdamage is linguistically related to braindamage for a reason.
@ryanbigg @rufuspost you say that now, but let's see if you can resist the flaming hoop on the skateboard ramp.
@filterfish I'll buy you a beer at roro, you can call me a sarcastic prick in person :)
@filterfish wow, don't know what came over me. Is this what it's like to read the Grauniad?
@filterfish power will always be alienated from the proletariat. Rise up and reclaim your birthright.
@scottdools "stumbled upon", hey? Not the product of hours of engorged research?
@joaomilho mac support is still a bit of a pain, but linux should be solid
@joaomilho new version with extra-hot compatibility coming out as soon as I have time to pull it together :)
@joaomilho fair enough. am working on a ruby/haskell bridge, but it's still pretty tricky to install. might be interesting soon:)
nothing like manually chasing database migrations to give you that deep thrill of satisfaction
@anathematic Ethics Five!
@cojames oh, schoolboy error. you wrapped the pillow around the wrong head!
@shapr #Haskell has spoiled you, compadre.
@AndrePang just saw toy story - saw your name in the credits and yelled like an idiot. Nice job.
@secretGeek Agda. http://wiki.portal.chalmers.se/agda/pmwiki.php
@ivanlogan Morlocks eat Eloi...
@joaomilho what's your Haskell/Ruby proposal on?
@brianmeidell @jlouis666 people seem  to either have a learning epiphany that makes other languages unsatisfying, or hate it passionately.
@elliottcable oh, do suck it up. This is Twitter, your two options are follow/unfollow. complaining is hideously boring.
readying my "it works on my machine"
@freshtonic can't you just :q! in vim? git always aborts on commits with that, at least.
gah, updated to iOS 4 and my apn settings broke, with no easy way to fix it. I can understand why people jailbreak.
@keithpitty don't encourage me, I might not come back :)
Off to central coast. Never needed a weekend away so bad.
@vornstar if it's a business app, totally. if it's techy, it's got to be Q.
@railsninja nah, just starting servers in the wrong environments for testing which happen to have some rows the same...
pretty sure these tests are passing accidentally
@TacticalGrace jeez, you FP guys get so high and might about having syntax you can parse without running...
@filterfish situation normal, then?
@anathematic can't help myself. is it wrong that i could do with a slice at 10:15?
I'm entering #CrustFreePizzaFriday because @Crust_Pizza is damn good and i'm hungry.
I need a beer more than I need oxygen. Hopefully @whalec is on song...
@ivanlogan very ish.
@jamesbritt gah, reminded again how painful the build is :/ working on it.
@jamesbritt btw, Hubris does work without type decls - you need to pass :no_strict => true, though. reckon it should be the default?
RT @jamesbritt: "James Britt presents Hubris: The Ruby/Haskell Bridge,  video from MWRC2010 http://post.ly/lOMj" -- oh hell yes.
@anathematic dude, do you use a different microblogging service when you have good days?
@GarryDanger wallet description in a bug report. Apparently also: generous internal features and a single magnetic stud.
buttery-soft hand feel
@freshtonic you should try Haskell. 10 million haskell threads ain't no thing.
@whalec righto - don't have my laptop, but I might come absorb some wisdom.
@whalec is it a hack night, or presentations, or ... ? I'd like to get better at Obj-C.
@gilesgoatboy I laughed, but then I was sad.
@railsninja verily, hear the words of our great lord Milner and his prophet, SimonPJ! All will be humbled (type-safely, of course...)
@railsninja it's the bane of my life. Leftover filesystem state, extra databases, solr remnants - this is why functional programming rocks
@railsninja clearing out the db?
@anathematic ah, another in the line of happy-to-be-eaten mascots: http://suicidefood.blogspot.com/
@perrynfowler still enjoying your "tap to start" shirt too, although a surprising number of people take it literally.
@cojames take off and nuke it from orbit.
@ryanbigg @railsninja I thought that was @joshprice
unsettling phrase of the day: "questing braintongue"
RT @mfeathers: SICP vs The Necronomicon http://bit.ly/bDlQtO
@prestonesque #firstworldproblem?
Lateness is a subjective concept and inextricably linked with the observer #cityrail #postmodernexcuses
@pat @toolmantim it sounds like a particularly obscure ethnic slur
Somehow managed to restrain myself from purchasing a two  hundred dollar vacuum-insulated beer stein. Is it cos I is responsible?

@DRMacIver 
begin
  silly_thing.silent_failure
rescue GnomeException
  # Nyah nyah
end
@atnan that always scares the crap out of me. Are our planes' systems so fragile that a puny radio emitter can take them down?
all my McLusky albums sound like love songs

I have Black Blood of the Earth.
I had one shot glass 5 hours ago.
I am still buzzing.


This cannot end well.
@stevelikesyou I did that twice a day for two weeks and I'm a fat bastard. You'll be fine.
@pigworker you mean "if it could be added", right? don't want that nasty personal stuff in there.
